de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization

Class FixedStationSync

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization.FixedStationSync

  • public class FixedStationSync
extends java.lang.Object
    Synchronizes fixed station database table parameters in the Local Database with the Server. Reads all the parameters of DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable from the Database and stores it in HashMaps. Creates StringRequests and inserts it in to a RequestQueue to push and pull Data from the Server. Clears the fixed station table before inserting Data that was pulled from the Server.

    Uses FixedStation to create a new fixed station Object and insert into local Database, the parameters that is pulled from the Server.

    See Also:
    DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable, SyncActivity, FixedStation, de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization

    • Method Detail

      • onClickFixedStationReadButton

        public void onClickFixedStationReadButton()
        Reads the Table and inserts the data from all the Columns of the Table in to their respective HashMap.
        Throws:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException - In case of error in reading database
        See Also:
        fixedStationCursor

      • formatUpdateTime

        private java.lang.String formatUpdateTime(double updateTime)

      • onClickFixedStationSyncButton

        public void onClickFixedStationSyncButton()
        Creates StringRequests as per the size of mmsiData data extracted from the local database and inserts all the requests in the RequestQueue A Stringrequest request for pushing the data is registered and added to the requestQueue. callback function Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) notifies whether the request was successful or not If it is unsuccessful or the connection is not established Response.Listener#error(VolleyError) gets called

      • onClickFixedStationPullButton

        public void onClickFixedStationPullButton()
        Function is used to pull data from internal database to the server A Stringrequest request for pulling the data is registered and added to the requestQueue. callback function Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) notifies whether the request was successful or not If it is unsuccessful or the connection is not established Response.Listener#error(VolleyError) gets called On pulling the data from the server internal database tables DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.fixedStationDeletedTable are cleared.

        The server sends the data in .xml format, therefore it has to extract the data based on the tags Inside Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) it loops through the entire xml file till it reaches the end of document. Based on the XmlPullParser.START_TAG, XmlPullParser.TEXT, XmlPullParser.END_TAG it adds the values received to the corresponding columns of the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable Each fixedStation is added to the fixedStationList which is individually taken and added to the internal database.

      • getDataCompleted

        public boolean getDataCompleted()

      • setBaseUrl

        public void setBaseUrl(java.lang.String baseUrl,
                       java.lang.String port)
        Used to initialize URL, pullURL and deleteURL
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - Url set by the administrator, which is stored in the local database
        port - port number set by the administrator, which is stored in the local database (default value is 80)

      • sendFSDeleteRequest

        private void sendFSDeleteRequest()
        Reads the Table and inserts the data from all the Columns of the Table in to their respective HashMap.
        Throws:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException - In case of error in reading database After reading the data, it creates string requests to forward the data to the server This facilitates the server to know which mmsi's should be marked for deletion since these stations are no longer used in caluculation of the grid.
